Title: Security update for the Linux Kernel (Live Patch 23 for SLE 12 SP3)

Notes.Text: Security update for the Linux Kernel (Live Patch 23 for SLE 12 SP3)
Notes.Title: Topic

Notes.Text:
This update for the Linux Kernel 4.4.175-94_79 fixes one issue.

The following security issue was fixed:

- CVE-2019-9213: Expand_downwards in mm/mmap.c lacked a check for the mmap minimum address, which made it easier for attackers to exploit kernel NULL pointer dereferences on non-SMAP platforms. This is related to a capability check for the wrong task (bsc#1128378).
Notes.Title: Details

Relationships.RelatesToProductReference: SUSE Linux Enterprise Live Patching 12 SP3

Vulnerabilities.Description: In the Linux kernel before 4.20.14, expand_downwards in mm/mmap.c lacks a check for the mmap minimum address, which makes it easier for attackers to exploit kernel NULL pointer dereferences on non-SMAP platforms. This is related to a capability check for the wrong task.
